intro: Senecio phyllolepis, commonly known as the leafy senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub with narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
